title: Brewers Rookie Misiorowski Sets Record with Hitless Streak in 2nd Start
snippets: Brewers rookie Jacob Misiorowski took a perfect game into the seventh inning of his second career start, becoming the first pitcher to start his big league career with 11 consecutive hitless innings as a starter since 1900.

A trip around the majors sees Jacob Misiorowski carry a perfect game into the seventh inning of his second career MLB start as the Brewers trounced the Twins 17–6, Cal Raleigh hit his 29th homer in the Mariners’ win over the Cubs, and more.
Jacob Misiorowski tossed six innings, striking out six, while Jackson Chourio and Joey Ortiz each drove in three runs to help the Milwaukee brewers beat the Minnesota Twins 17-6.
Bobby Witt Jr. hit his 10th home run of the year and Jonathan India drove in three runs to help the Kansas City Royals beat the San Diego Padres 6-5.
Miguel Rojas knocked a two-run homer and Enrique Hernandez went 2-3 with a pair of doubles as the Los Angeles Dodgers topped the Washington Nationals 6-5.

Cal Raleigh continued his historic season hitting two home runs, reaching 29 on the season and break the MLB record for most home runs by a catcher before the All-Star break as the Seattle Mariners beat the Chicago Cubs 9-4.
Agustín Ramírez hit a three-run homer in the third and finished with four RBIs on the day to lead the Miami Marlins to a 6-2 victory over the Atlanta Braves.

Home runs from Corey Seager and Adolis Garcia propelled the Texas Rangers to a 6-2 victory over the Pittsburgh Pirates. Jacob deGrom picked up the win on the mound, striking out seven across six innings of work.
Nick Castellanos hit a two-run homer, Zack Wheeler punched out eight batters in five innings, and the Philadelphia Phillies cruised to a 10-2 win over the New York Mets.
Yandy Diaz homered twice and Matt Thaiss drove in four runs as the Tampa Bay Rays rode an offensive explosion to a 14-8 win over the Detroit Tigers.

Ceddanne Rafaela had three hits including a home run and finished with two RBIs while David Hamilton also went yard and drove in two runs to elevate the Boston Red Sox to a 7-5 win over the San Francisco Giants.
Andrew Benintendi hit a solo shot and added an RBI-single, while Luis Robert smacked a two-run shot to help the Chicago White Sox beat the Toronto Blue Jays 7-1.

Bullpen days are what they are – a last resort that’s great when it works, awful when it doesn’t, and it sure was awful Friday night when the Toronto Blue Jays ran through seven pitchers during a 7-1 drubbing from the Chicago White Sox.
Every five games the Toronto Blue Jays' bullpen has had to step up.
Righty Jose Berrios is slated to start Saturday for the Toronto Blue Jays as they look to bounce back from a brutal 7-1 loss to the Chicago White Sox in their series opener Friday night.
Luis Robert Jr.'s two-run homer was the highlight of a four-run inning as the White Sox routed the Toronto Blue Jays 7-1 on Friday as Chicago snapped an eight-game losing skid.
The Brewers try for the interleague series victory over the Twins on a sizzling Saturday afternoon at Target Field.
Misiorowski threw 29 pitches 100 mph or faster on Friday night
Jacob Misiorowski threw 11 no-hit innings to start his MLB career. The Brewers rookie has some of the best stuff of any prospect in the game, and his upside is unlimited.

title: UK Parliament Approves Assisted Dying Bill for Terminally Ill Adults
snippets: Some critics, including disability rights campaigner Lord Shinkwin, indicate they will try to amend a bill, backed by MPs, to legalise assisted dying.

Campaigner, who has terminal cancer, hopes bill will make it past any potential obstacles in the Lords

The assisted dying bill, if it becomes law, will remove the burden of seeing a loved one die in pain, the campaigner Esther Rantzen has said, insisting its backers have got right the balan
The bill gives terminally ill patients the right to end their lives, but the details have yet to be confirmed.
Friday’s vote means that assisted dying will almost certainly become available to some terminally ill patients in England and Wales.
MPs vote to back a bill legalising assisted dying in England and Wales.
British lawmakers on Friday confirmed their support for assisted suicide for some terminally ill people, after months of scrutiny that followed an initial vote last year.
titles: Esther Rantzen urges Lords not to block assisted dying

summary: British MPs have passed a bill allowing terminally ill adults in England and Wales the option of assisted dying. This historic decision, following intense debate and scrutiny, marks a significant change in the law, reflecting deep personal stakes on both sides of the issue. The legislation's approval was closely contested but ultimately confirmed, signifying a major shift in the approach to end-of-life care within the UK.
constructiveness_reason: The story reports on a significant legislative change, providing readers with a deeper understanding of the issue and the implications of the decision. It also highlights progress in the approach to end-of-life care within the UK.

title: Palestinian Activist Released from Louisiana Detention After Judge's Ruling
snippets: Palestinian activist Mahmoud Khalil was released after three months in immigration detention.
The former Columbia University graduate student is expected to head to New York to reunite with his wife and infant son, born while Khalil was detained.
Mahmoud Khalil ordered released on bail

summary: Mahmoud Khalil, a Palestinian activist and Columbia University graduate, has been released from a Louisiana immigration detention facility. His release followed a federal judge's ruling that he is "not a danger to the community – period." Khalil, a permanent US resident, had been in detention since his arrest in March. Upon his release, he expressed a bittersweet feeling as he emerged into the Louisiana sun. His release has brought relief to his family, marking the end of his months-long detention.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about the release of a detained activist, which can contribute to the reader's understanding of the legal process and immigration detention. title: Man Dies in Motorcycle Collision with Parked ATV in Ontario
snippets: A 40-year-old man has died after his motorcycle struck an all-terrain vehicle that was parked on a roadway. The crash occurred at about 10 p.m. on County Road 11 about 60 km southeast of Chesterville. Ontario Provincial Police said on social media Saturday that a passerby performed CPR on the victim

A crash involving a motorcycle and an ATV has left one man dead. It happened on Friday just after 10 p.m. OPP officers from Stormont, Dundas and Glengarry were called to the scene on County Road 11 southeast of Chesterville – approximately 60 km outside of Ottawa. The initial investigation det
titles: Motorcyclist dies in collision on rural road near Chesterville, Ont.
Motorcyclist, 40, dies in crash with parked ATV

summary: A 40-year-old man died after his motorcycle collided with a parked ATV on County Road 11, about 60 km southeast of Chesterville, Ontario. The accident occurred just after 10 p.m. on Friday. Ontario Provincial Police from Stormont, Dundas, and Glengarry responded to the scene. Despite a passerby performing CPR, the man was pronounced dead. The OPP is currently investigating the incident.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides basic awareness of a tragic event but does not offer any actionable insights or deeper understanding. It does not report on solutions, improvements, or attempts to solve problems, nor does it increase clarity around systems, causes, trends, or impacts.

title: Study Links Cold North Atlantic Patch to Weakening Ocean Current

constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about the climate system and increases awareness about the impact of ocean currents on the climate. However, it doesn't highlight any solutions or improvements to the problem.

title: IEA: 70% of Fossil Fuel Methane Emissions Cuttable with Current Tech
snippets: The International Energy Agency estimates that 70 percent of the fossil fuel sector’s methane emissions could be cut with existing technologies—many of which would save polluters money.
titles: Methane Pollution Has Cheap, Effective Solutions That Aren’t Being Used
summary: The International Energy Agency (IEA) has determined that up to 70% of methane emissions from the fossil fuel sector could be reduced by implementing currently available technologies. These methods are not only feasible but would also lead to cost savings for the companies responsible for the emissions. This finding underscores the potential for significant environmental benefits through the adoption of existing solutions in the industry.
constructiveness_reason: This story is highly constructive as it provides useful insights about the potential of current technologies to significantly reduce methane emissions. It also reports on a solution to a major environmental problem, and increases awareness about the role of the fossil fuel sector in climate change.

title: New Quantum Concept Allows Entanglement Extraction Without Altering State
